results.title: How Gayle King Kept Her Cool in the R. Kelly Interview
results.abstract: In his first interview since his arrest on sex abuse charges, Kelly screamed, jumped from his chair and cried. King remained calm. What was going through her mind?

results.title: Netflix Finally Brings Romance to Reality TV
results.abstract: It doesn’t need roses or diamond rings. “Dating Around” manages to find romantic tension in the unlikeliest of places: the blind date.

results.title: Carolee Schneeman, Visionary Feminist Performance Artist, Dies at 79
results.abstract: In one performance piece, she stood nude on a table, posing like a studio model, while reading from a book of her collected writings.

results.title: 'Late Night’ and ‘Shazam’ Lead the Week’s Best Trailers
results.abstract: Mindy Kaling and Emma Thompson star in the Sundance movie about a writer and a talk-show host, while Zachary Levi’s superhero finds more laughs in a new clip.

results.title: Think Your Date Was Awkward? Listen to Hers
results.abstract: Catherine Cohen, 27, hosts Cabernet Cabaret, a weekly standup show at Club Cumming in the East Village.

multimedia.caption: “Boys didn’t want to kiss me, so I had to be funny to win them over,” said Catherine Cohen, a comedian.

results.title: ‘Star Trek: Discovery’ Season 2, Episode 8: The Mother of All Callbacks
results.abstract: This week’s “Star Trek: Discovery” is one of the most ambitious of the entire franchise. If you’re a fan of the original series, you might see some familiar characters.

results.title: Is Satire Possible in the Age of Trump?
results.abstract: Parodies of the president proliferate in books and on TV. But how do you ridicule a man who seems to have mastered the strategies of those who would hold him to account through humor?

results.title: There are Millions of New Millionaires, but Not at Art Sales
results.abstract: The annual Art Basel and UBS report shows market growth is stagnating. “The art world seems to have a conversion problem,” one expert said.

multimedia.caption: “Henry Geldzahler and Christopher Scott,” a 1969 double portrait by David Hockney, sold at Christie’s on Wednesday for about $50 million.

results.title: Christie’s to Auction Drue Heinz’s Art Collection
results.abstract: One auction, in May, will include works by Amedeo Modigliani, Pierre Bonnard and Henri Matisse; an auction in June will center on the decorative arts.

results.title: ‘Juanita’ Review: A Heartfelt Rallying Cry for Black Women Sabbaticals
results.abstract: The film is a testament to how necessary and urgent it is for black women to embark on purely selfish adventures in order to rediscover themselves.

results.title: Graphic Novels That Will Keep Kids Reading
results.abstract: Jerry Craft’s tale of an artistic black kid navigating a mostly white prep school, and Lincoln Peirce’s new series about a medieval girl who longs to be a knight.
